attrib.name: ObjectType
attrib.para: Type of object

attrib.name: ExtensionCount
attrib.para: Extension count

attrib.name: RootType
attrib.para: Root type

attrib.name: TypeOfData
attrib.para: Type of the elements

attrib.name: NrOfElements
attrib.para: Number of elements in the array

class.name: S_CFACTIONLIST
class.para: An ActionList structure contains a pointer to a list of Action pointers to be executed when some event occurred. An example of an event is a hard key being pressed.

note.para: There are also GID's that add functionality to the device, however they are not the same as actions.

attrib.name: cfActions
attrib.para: The actions to perform.

class.name: S_CFACTION
class.para: An action is something that needs to be executed when an action list is being played.

note.para: There are also GID's that add functionality to the device, however they are not the same as actions.

class.name: S_CFACTIVITYALIAS
class.para: The ActivityAlias structure contains the pointers required to perform an ActivityAlias action.

attrib.name: cfActivity
attrib.para: Activitiy to jump to

class.name: S_CFACTIVITY
class.para: The Activity structure forms the entry point for an Activity, like home, activities, macros and system area. It contains general information about the activity.

attrib.name: cfHardKeys
attrib.para: The hard keys associated with the activity

attrib.name: cfPages
attrib.para: The pages contained in the activity

bit.name: Hidden
bit.para: Whether the activity should be hidden (1) or not (0)

attrib.name: cfScriptName
attrib.para: The name of this activity when used in a script.

attrib.name: cfScript
attrib.para: The activity script.

attrib.name: cfActionList
attrib.para: The actions (macro) for this Activity.

attrib.name: cfBackground
attrib.para: Image to use as background when in activity.

class.name: S_CFBITMAP
class.para: The Bitmap structure contains information about bitmaps for buttons, icons... The bitmap is stored in a format optimized for display on the Control Panel.

attrib.name: TransparencyColor
attrib.para: RGB value to be used as transparency color

class.name: S_CFBOOLEANSTATEMENT
class.para: Represents a Boolean statement command to be sent to an extender. These statements allow combining the results of one or more statements using Boolean logic.

attrib.name: BooleanStatementType
attrib.para: Type of the Boolean statement.

attrib.name: cfFirstConditionalStatement
attrib.para: first condition operand

attrib.name: cfSecondConditionalStatement
attrib.para: second condition operand

class.name: S_CFBUTTONALIAS
class.para: The ButtonAlias structure contains the pointers required to perform a ButtonAlias action.

attrib.name: cfActivity
attrib.para: Activity to jump to

attrib.name: cfButton
attrib.para: Button (within the acitivity) to jump to

class.name: S_CFBUTTON
class.para: A button is a S_CFVISUALOBJECT item. As stated before, an S_CFVISUALOBJECT structure does not exist. This is more of a meta structure for the actual items, one of which is the button.

entry.name: NORMAL
TOGGLE
entry.para: A toggle button; remains pressed until it is pressed again.

entry.name: ENUM
entry.para: Enumeration button; like a normal button but it contains extra bitmaps to support a string of different looks. Every time an enumeration button is pressed, it will shift to the next bitmap in a circular manner.

attrib.name: Gid
attrib.para: Gid of the button

attrib.name: TextColorPressed
attrib.para: text color of the button for the pressed state

attrib.name: TextBGColorPressed
attrib.para: text background color of the button for the pressed state

attrib.name: cfActionList
attrib.para: actions for this button.

attrib.name: cfScriptName
attrib.para: name of this button when used in a script.

attrib.name: cfScript
attrib.para: button script.

class.name: S_CFCESERVER
class.para: This structure represents an Audio/Video server activity that can play multimedia content and that can be controlled using the Maestro.

attrib.name: Activity
attrib.para: It is effectively a specialization of a user device that has more properties than a normal device.

attrib.name: IpAddress
attrib.para: Array of 16 characters representing the well known IP format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx

attrib.name: PortNumber
attrib.para: IP Port number to communicate with this server.

attrib.name: ServerName
attrib.para: Name for the server instead of an IP Address, can be used to discover the server on the network

attrib.name: Brand
attrib.para: brand identifier of this Audio/Video server (currently ESCIENT, IMERGE and MCEPC)

attrib.name: PlayerName
attrib.para: player name (if supported by the CE Server)

attrib.name: cfActionList
attrib.para: the actions (macro) for this Activity.

class.name: S_CFCONTROLFLOW
class.para: Represents a Control Flow command to be sent to an extender. These statements alter the flow of execution within a block.

attrib.name: ControlFlowStatementType
attrib.para: Type of the Control Flow statement.

attrib.name: cfConditionalStatement
attrib.para: Any S_CFSTATEMENT to be used as a condition

class.name: S_CFDBCODE
class.para: The DBCode represents the DataBase Code.
It contains all properties needed to retrieve the actual IR code indexed by the UDP_ properties.

attrib.name: UDP_BrandId
attrib.para: brand ID of this database code

attrib.name: UDP_CodeSetId
attrib.para: code set ID of this database code

attrib.name: UDP_DeviceId
attrib.para: device ID of this database code

attrib.name: UDP_FunctionId
attrib.para: function ID of this database code

attrib.name: Duration
attrib.para: Duration that the IR code should be sent

attrib.name: cfDevice
attrib.para: device that this function belongs to.

class.name: S_CFDELAY
class.para: This represents a delay action.

attrib.name: Duration
attrib.para: Duration of this delay action. In milliseconds.

class.name: S_CFDEVICE
class.para: The Device Structure forms the entry point for a device. It contains the information relevant for a device as defined in the editor.

note.para: This structure is only filled from PEP 2.0 onwards. In PEP1.x Activities and devices are one and the same since there is no split between GUI and control. Starting from PEP 2.0 this is introduced so the existing S_CFACTIVITY structure will carry the GUI information and the S_CFDEVICE structure will carry the control information.

attrib.name: cfExtender
attrib.para: The extender associated with a device

attrib.name: cfPort
attrib.para: The extender port associated with the device

attrib.name: cfScriptName
attrib.para: The name of this activity when used in a script.

attrib.name: cfFunctions
attrib.para: The functions defined for the device. The type of the functions is dependant on the device type.

listitem.para: Devices of type S_CFSERIALDEVICE contain S_CFSERIALCOMMAND functions.
Devices of type S_CFIRDEVICE contain S_CFIRCODE and/or S_CFDBCODE functions.

note.para: Functions are not duplicated in the CF, if a device function is used in different ActionLists only an S_CFFUNCTION structure will be present in CF and it will be referenced by the ActionLists. This restriction is possible since serial and IR functions can’t be edited per actionlist in PEP2.0.

If this restriction becomes invalid then the S_CFDEVICE should reference the S_CFFUNCTION with the original values and the actionlist will reference copies of the original function with the modified values but the function data itself remains unduplicated and referenced by the original and the copies.

class.name: S_CFETHERNETCONFIG
class.para: This structure defines the Ethernet properties to be used when an Ethernet interface is available

attrib.name: ip_config
attrib.para: IP configuration for the Ethernet interface

attrib.name: interfaceIndex
attrib.para: Number from 0 to 255. Default is 0.

bit.name: Enabled
bit.para: indicates if Ethernet is enabled (1) or disabled (0).

class.name: S_CFEXTENDER
class.para: This structure represents the extender used to control high end equipment using different kinds of ports.

attrib.name: IpAddress
attrib.para: Array of 16 characters representing the well known IP format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx

attrib.name: cfPorts
attrib.para: Ports associated with the extender

attrib.name: SubType
attrib.para: Type of extender.

class.name: S_CFFIRMKEY
class.para: A firm key is a hard button that has a corresponding Button on the LCD display. The Button can contain the label of the firm key, describing the actual function of the firm key.
The FirmKey structure consists of an identifier of the hard button, a pointer to the Button and a pointer to an action list that must be played when the firm key is being pressed.

attrib.name: cfLabel
attrib.para: Label of the firm key.

attrib.name: cfFirmKeyButton
attrib.para: Soft button associated with the firm key.

attrib.name: cfScript
attrib.para: Firm key script.

class.name: S_CFFILE
class.para: This structure contains a pointer to raw binary data. In CF format versions prior to 3.3, this structure was called S_CFFONTFILE, and was specific to TrueType or OpenType files.

attrib.name: FileName
attrib.para: Filename associated with the raw binary data.

attrib.name: FileSize
attrib.para: The size of the binary data

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to file content stored in CF. If the structure is interpreted as a font, a null value will cause the default panel font to be used.

enum.entry: Script: JavaScript, UTF-8 encoding (MIME type: application/javascript; charset=utf-8)
Audio: MPEG-1 or MPEG-2 stream containing audio compressed with layer I, layer II or layer III compression (MIME type: audio/mpeg)
Audio: Ogg bitstream containing audio data (MIME type: audio/ogg)
Audio: Ogg bitstream containing audio data compressed with the Vorbis codec (MIME type: audio/ogg; codecs=vorbis)
Audio: Ogg bitstream containing audio data compressed with the Speex codec (MIME type: audio/ogg; codecs=speex)
Text: Unicode, UTF-8 encoding (MIME type: text/plain; charset=utf-8)

attrib.name: cfName
attrib.para: The name of the font.
Name “FONT_NONE” and a NULL pointer for this field behave the same.

attrib.name: Size
attrib.para: The size of the font

attrib.name: cfFontFile
attrib.para: If null or the extention is not set, the default font is used.

class.name: S_CFFUNCTION
class.para: This structure encapsulates all actions that can be sent to an extender.

attrib.name: Name
attrib.para: name of this function

attrib.name: cfExtender
attrib.para: extender on which to execute the function

attrib.name: PortNumber
attrib.para: Port number of the extender

class.name: S_CFHARDKEY
class.para: The HardKey structure describes a hard key. A hard key has an identifier and an action list.

attrib.name: KeyID
attrib.para: Id of the hard key, as defined by its position in the key matrix

attrib.name: Gid
attrib.para: Gid of this hardkey

attrib.name: cfActionList
attrib.para: Actions to perform.

attrib.name: cfScript
attrib.para: Hard key script.

class.name: S_CFIMAGE
class.para: This structure abstracts the concept of an image (bitmap, png etc.)

attrib.name: Size
attrib.para: The size of the bitmap data in bytes

attrib.name: IsTransparent
attrib.para: Indicates whether this image has transparency information. If i.e. a transparency color is set or an alpha mask is provided it can be that this property is set to false and that we thus have to discard this information.

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to the binary data

class.name: S_CFIOCOMMAND
class.para: Represents an I/O command to be sent to an extender.

attrib.name: IOStatementType
attrib.para: Type of the I/O statement.

attrib.name: State
attrib.para: State of the port to read.

attrib.name: TimeOut
attrib.para: Number of milliseconds to wait for port to change state

class.name: S_CFIP_CONF_EXT
class.para: This structure defines the properties to be stored for IP configuration. It improves on S_CFIP_CONF that is still used as a contained structure part of S_CFWIFI, this can’t be changed anymore for backwards compatibility with older firmware. From now on any new definition of IP settings should be done using a pointer to S_CFIP_CONF_EXT.

bit.name: dhcp
bit.para: Indicates whether DHCP is enabled (1) of not (0).

attrib.name: address
attrib.para: IP address of the Maestro device. Array of 16 characters representing the well known IP format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx.

attrib.name: netmask
attrib.para: Netmask for the network the Maestro device is connected to. See Address for the format description.

attrib.name: gateway
attrib.para: Gateway for the network the Maestro device is connected to. See Address for the format description.

attrib.name: dns
attrib.para: Character array specifying the dns properties in dotted notation.

class.name: S_CFIP_CONF
class.para: This structure defines the properties to be stored for IP configuration. It is part of the IP network settings.

attrib.name: Object
attrib.para: Since this structure has been used as a contained structure it can’t be extended and no type has been assigned to it.

attrib.name: address
attrib.para: IP address of the Maestro device. Array of 16 characters representing the well known IP format xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx.

attrib.name: netmask
attrib.para: Netmask for the network the Maestro device is connected to. See Address for the format description.

attrib.name: gateway
attrib.para: Gateway for the network the Maestro device is connected to. See Address for the format description.

class.name: S_CFIRCODE
class.para: The IRCode structure contains the IR data that needs to be sent to a consumer device.

attrib.name: IrType
attrib.para: The type of this IR Code.

attrib.name: Size
attrib.para: Size of the IR-code

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to IR-code data. CF does not define the format of this data, in order not to impose constraints on the format.

attrib.name: Duration
attrib.para: Duration that the IR code should be sent

attrib.name: cfDevice
attrib.para: device that this function belongs to.

class.name: S_CFJPG
class.para: The JPG structure contains information about images in the JPEG format (currently only used for Cover Art but can also be for buttons etc.).

class.name: S_CFJUMPALIAS
class.para: The JumpAlias structure contains the pointer required to perform a jump action.

attrib.name: cfActivity
attrib.para: Activity to jump to

attrib.name: cfPage
attrib.para: Page (within the activity) to jump to

class.name: S_CFKEYALIAS
class.para: The KeyAlias structure contains the pointers required to perform a KeyAlias action.

attrib.name: cfActivity
attrib.para: Activity to jump to

attrib.name: KeyId
attrib.para: The ID of the key of which we need to play the actionlist

class.name: S_CFLABELLEDOBJECT
class.para: The S_CFLABELLEDOBJECT structure groups all objects that have a label attached to them. It extends the S_CFOBJECT structure. The main reason we introduce this structure is because previously many structures had a pointer to a string, but the fields were called differently for every structure, making generic handling of the string property quite difficult. This structure is supposed to simplify this.

attrib.name: cfLabel
attrib.para: the property this object incapsulates

class.name: S_CFLIGHTING
class.para: This structure represents a Lighting Control activity that can be controlled using the Maestro.

attrib.name: Activity
attrib.para: It is effectively a specialization of a user device that has more properties than a normal device.

attrib.name: cfExtender
attrib.para: The extender to which the Lighting control device is connected

attrib.name: PortNumber
attrib.para: The port number of the extender

attrib.name: cfSceneNames
attrib.para: the names of all the scenes in this Lutron activity

attrib.name: cfSceneNumbers
attrib.para: the numbers of all the scenes that are to be shown in this Lutron activity.
The Scene buttons are defined in the System CF, these numbers indicate which buttons need to be rendered on the screen

note.para: Both the cfSceneNames and cfSceneNumbers arrays have to be of the same size. The cfSceneNumbers array does not contain any 0 elements, it contains the (possibly non-contiguous) sequence of scenes to be drawn.
The cfSceneNames array contains the pointers to each string for the scene at the same index in the cfSceneNumbers array.
If a scene has no string, then an empty string will be provided for it, resulting in no NULL pointers in the cfSceneNames array either.

attrib.name: Brand
attrib.para: the brand of the lighting activity

attrib.name: cfActionList
attrib.para: the actions (macro) for this Activity.

class.name: S_CFLISTBOX
class.para: A ListBox is Visual object. This is more of a meta structure for the actual items, one of which is the ListBox.

attrib.name: VisualObject
attrib.para: The following images are not separate fields but are part of the images array of the ancestor structure. They need to be in the order like specified in this table (ListBoxImage, BulletImage, SelectedBulletImage, ItemImage, SelectedItemImage, ExpandImage, array of StatusImages)!

entry.para: Pointer to image structure, used for the list box itself.
Pointer to image structure, used for the bullet image in an unselected list box entry.
Set to NULL if not required.
If the Listbox is subtype CheckBoxes then this is the unchecked image and it is mandatory.
Pointer to image structure, used for the bullet image in a selected list box entry.
Set to NULL if not required.
If the Listbox is subtype CheckBoxes then this is the checked image and it is mandatory.
Pointer to image structure, used for the item background image in an unselected list box entry.
Set to NULL if not required.
Pointer to image structure, used for the item background image in an selected list box entry.
Set to NULL if not required.
Pointer to image structure, used for the expansion image icon in a list box entry.
Set to NULL if not required.

Image structure used for indicating a status of the listbox item. There can be multiple status images defined for the listbox. We use a sequence of pointers to images defined in the VisualObject images array after the ExpandImage.

attrib.name: Bitmask
attrib.para: Style of the listbox. This is a combination of flags.
Bit 0 of BitMask signifies that CheckBoxes per item are off (0) or on(1) i.e. enabled/disabled for the list box as a whole.
Bits 1 and 2 of BitMask signify if item selection is off (00), single line only (01) or multi-line (10) for the list box as a whole

attrib.name: Gid
attrib.para: Gid of the listbox

attrib.name: SelectedTextColor
attrib.para: selected item text color of the ListBox.

attrib.name: SelectedBGColor
attrib.para: selected item background color of the Listbox.

attrib.name: HScrollBar
attrib.para: the scrollbar item that represents a horizontal scrollbar.
NULL if no horizontal scrollbar available.

attrib.name: VScrollBar
attrib.para: the scrollbar item that represents a vertical scrollbar.
NULL if no vertical scrollbar available.

class.name: S_CFPAGE
class.para: The Page structure contains all the data needed to build up a page. A page consists of items, such as buttons, multi-buttons, panels and status fields.

bits.name: SubType
bits.para: Subtype of the page - *FIXME* specify subtypes

bit.name: Hidden
bit.para: Indicates if this page is hidden (1) or not (0).

note.para: S_CFVISUALOBJECT objects as such should not be present in the binary CF. Instead this array should contain structures deriving from S_CFVISUALOBJECT, such as S_CFBUTTON and S_CFPANEL.
There are no constraints on the number of keys and items on the page. They are all contained in an S_CFARRAY from which the size can be retrieved.

attrib.name: cfFirmKeys
attrib.para: the actual firm keys for this page.

attrib.name: cfScriptName
attrib.para: name of this page when used in a script.

attrib.name: cfScript
attrib.para: the page script.

attrib.name: RepeatTimerValue
attrib.para: Value in seconds specifying the time interval between execution of the attached script.
0 means execute once.

class.name: S_CFPANEL
class.para: A Panel is an item. As stated before, an Item structure does not exist. This is more of a meta structure for the actual items, one of which is the Panel.
Panels can only contain a bitmap and a label. They do not receive user input.

attrib.name: IsTransparent
attrib.para: Indicates whether this Panel is transparent or not. To support transparent text panels.

attrib.name: Gid
attrib.para: Gid of the Panel

attrib.name: cfScriptName
attrib.para: the name of this panel when used in a script.

attrib.name: IsAlphaTransparent
attrib.para: Indicates if the alpha mask needs to be used to draw this image transparently

attrib.name: TransparencyColor
attrib.para: RGB value to be used on this PNG as a transparency color

class.name: S_CFPORT
class.para: The S_CFPORT structure abstracts the port of the extenders.

attrib.name: PortType
attrib.para: The kind of port.

attrib.name: PortNumber
attrib.para: Numeric identifier

class.name: S_CFROOT
class.para: The S_CFROOT structure forms the entry point for the configuration file (CF). This structure contains basic information about the configuration and pointers to the other parts of the configuration. It is an abstract structure, only S_CFUSERROOT and S_CFSYSTEMROOT should be instantiated (see next section).

attrib.name: Signature
attrib.para: CF Signature used for detection of a valid CF format.
This 8 byte signature has to be: 0x50, 0x43, 0x43, 0x46, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xff.

attrib.name: CF_Version_Minor
attrib.para: Indicating the minor version of the CF format (Internal release) – as binary

attrib.name: CF_Version_Major
attrib.para: Indicating the major version of the CF format (External release) – as binary

attrib.name: OemId
attrib.para: OEM Identification (PHILIPS or MARANTZ)

attrib.name: ProductId
attrib.para: Product identification.

class.name: S_CFSCRIPT
class.para: This structure encapsulates a string with extended length to be used as a script, allowing virtually unlimited script lengths.

attrib.name: Length
attrib.para: The number of bytes in the data array. UTF-8 encoding uses variable byte length, so this value should not be interpreted as the number of characters!

note.para: ASCII is valid UTF-8, which means the first 128 characters defined in ASCII are also encoded as one byte characters in UTF-8.

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to the array of character bytes, defining the actual string. It is a stream of UTF-8 bytes.

warning.para: A bug in older PEP1 versions caused binary CFs to be generated with scripts using Windows codepage 1252 encoding, instead of UTF-8.
To compensate for this, the Maestro control panel firmware will attempt to interpret scripts in binary CFs with CF format version 3.0 or earlier as Windows 1252 encoding instead of UTF-8.

class.name: S_CFSCROLLBAR
class.para: A ScrollBar contains the data structures required to implement scrollbar functionality. It is an item that can be used in conjunction with other items to provide scrolling on the object it is attached to.

attrib.name: Direction
attrib.para: Direction of the ScrollBar.

attrib.name: Gid
attrib.para: Gid of the ScrollBar

attrib.name: UpLeftButton
attrib.para: up OR left ScrollButton.
NULL if no ScrollButton.

attrib.name: DownRightButton
attrib.para: down OR right ScrollButton.
NULL if no ScrollButton.

class.name: S_CFSCROLLBUTTON
class.para: A ScrollButton contains the data structures required to implement the buttons on a scrollbar.

attrib.name: Direction
attrib.para: Direction of the ScrollButton.

attrib.name: ScrollStyle
attrib.para: Style of scrolling.

class.name: S_CFSERIALCOMMAND
class.para: Represents an RS232 command to be sent to an extender. Serial port settings are sent along with every statement.

attrib.name: Speed
attrib.para: Speed of the data communication on the serial port in bits per second.

attrib.name: DataBits
attrib.para: Number of data bits to be used in the communication.

attrib.name: Parity
attrib.para: Parity check.

attrib.name: StopBits
attrib.para: Number of stopbits.

attrib.name: SerialStatementType
attrib.para: Type of serial command.

attrib.name: Length
attrib.para: Amount of data to read

attrib.name: Expire
attrib.para: unused

attrib.name: Ttl
attrib.para: Time in milliseconds to continue repeating the serial command

attrib.name: Delay
attrib.para: Time between two possible consecutive repetitions of the specified serial command

attrib.name: DataSize
attrib.para: Number of bytes pointed to by cfData

attrib.name: TimeOut
attrib.para: Time in milliseconds after which to stop reading data

attrib.name: Count
attrib.para: Number of times to send the serial command (1 = send once)

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to the character data

attrib.name: cfDevice
attrib.para: the device that this function belongs to.

bit.name: WhilePressed
bit.para: Defines if action can be played while pressed or always as single shot.

class.name: S_CFSETTINGS
class.para: The Settings structure contains the settings for the Maestro configuration file.

attrib.name: HeaderInfo
attrib.para: This variable is controlled by the application to detect valid settings.

attrib.name: LCDTimeOut
attrib.para: Timeout of the LCD, in seconds.

attrib.name: LCDBacklightBrightness
attrib.para: Value of the LCD brightness, in percentage.

attrib.name: KeyBacklightTimeOut
attrib.para: Timeout of the key backlight, in seconds..

attrib.name: KeyBacklightBrightness
attrib.para: Value of the key brightness, in percentage.

attrib.name: GeneralVolume
attrib.para: Volume for the display related sounds: touch screen sounds, jog dial, sounds in actionlists. In percentage.

attrib.name: KeyVolume
attrib.para: Volume of all the hard keys (including the firm keys). In percentage.

attrib.name: TimeFormat
attrib.para: Format to be used when displaying the time.

note.para: DateFormat is not used anymore, only one format was supported: DATEFORMAT_DDMMYYYY

attrib.name: TimeZone
attrib.para: Index into the time zone enum.

Because of the complex nature of time zone rules (this involves: time offset from UTC, varying rules on the exact moment of transition to and from daylight savings time, ..), the firmware in the Maestro control panel uses the Olson Database, and refers to timezones using IDs in the form of Area/Location.

attrib.name: DayLightSavingTime
attrib.para: Indicates whether we want to enable or disable the daylight savings time feature, that adjusts the time according to the time zone that was set in the TimeZone field.

attrib.name: TiltSensorMode
attrib.para: Indicates whether the tilt sensor is on of off.

attrib.name: AnimationMode
attrib.para: Specifies the animation mode, the kind of page transitions the Maestro device performs when switching between activities or pages.

attrib.name: CurrentLanguageIndex
attrib.para: Index of the current language.

attrib.name: FirmKeysBehaviour
attrib.para: Indicates what should be the effect of the first press on a firmkey when the device is asleep.

attrib.name: CursorKeysBehaviour
attrib.para: Indicates what should be the effect of the first press on a cursor key when the device is asleep. See FirmKeysBehaviour for the possible values.

attrib.name: UserAreaTop
attrib.para: The user can choose in the editor which part of the screen must be scrolled when navigating in use mode. This field indicates the top x and y coordinates of the scrollable area.

attrib.name: UserAreaBottom
attrib.para: The user can choose in the editor which part of the screen must be scrolled when navigating in use mode. This field indicates the bottom x and y coordinates of the scrollable area.

attrib.name: WiFiNetworkConfig
attrib.para: Contained S_CFWIFI structure, defining all the properties of the wireless network, split up in a number of structures.

attrib.name: WiFiTimeOut
attrib.para: Timeout for the WiFi connection, in minutes. If value is 0 then WiFi is disabled.

attrib.name: ProjectName
attrib.para: The name of the Project

attrib.name: WiFiNetworkConfig_dns
attrib.para: Character array specifying the dns properties in dotted notation.

attrib.name: EthernetConfig
attrib.para: Definition of the network settings to apply to the Ethernet interface, in case it is available.
WiFi and Ethernet are, for now, mutually exclusive so they should not be enabled in the CF at the same time.
If extension bit is not set (older CF version) then Ethernet is disabled (not used).
Older firmware versions that do not support this extension will always use the WiFi settings.

attrib.name: WiFiTuning
attrib.para: Definition of the WiFi tuning settings settings to apply to the WiFi interface, in case it is available.
If extension bit is not set (older CF version) then generic settings are used.

class.name: S_CFSLIDERBAR
class.para: A SliderBar is an item that allows the setting of a value by using a sliding bar a user can control. It also allows the displaying of an indication bar on the background, allowing a user to associate a setting with a relevant measurement.

attrib.name: VisualObject
attrib.para: The images in the VisualObject structure need to be in the order like specified in the following table:

entry.para: The background image for a single unit. An indicator shall be created by placing TotalUnits of this image side by side separated with a margin of 1 pixel.
A border shall be drawn around the slider bar with 1-pixel margin. The thickness of the border shall be 2-pixels.
The right margin (or left margin if text is on the right) between the soft button border and slider borderline shall be 8-pixels.
Top and bottom margins shall be 4-pixels.
The foreground image for a single unit. Depending on a measurement value this image shall replace the background image starting from the left hand side.
Must be set to NULL if no indicator bar is required.
Slider image in the middle section. When a setting is required that is in the middle of the slider, this image shall be used to indicate that value.
Must be set to NULL if no indicator bar is required.
Slider image in the leftmost section. When the slider setting is at the leftmost column, this image a setting is required that is in the middle of the slider, this image shall be used.
Must be set to NULL if no indicator bar is required.
Slider image in the leftmost section. When the slider setting is at the leftmost column, this image a setting is required that is in the middle of the slider, this image shall be used.
Must be set to NULL if no indicator bar is required.

attrib.name: softButton
attrib.para: Defines a soft button item on which the slider bar is placed. Slider bar placement depends on the text alignment on the soft button. It will be placed opposite to the soft button text. If soft button text is centered it will be placed on the right hand side of the button.

attrib.name: TotalIndications
attrib.para: Total number of units to be placed on the slider bar. This number also determines the size of the slider bar together with BackgroundImage width, the Gap_size and the Line thickness. A measurement value to be displayed on the slider bar shall be scaled to this value.

attrib.name: TotalSliders
attrib.para: Total resolution of settings on the slider bar. Slider bar movement steps to left or right is based on this value. A setting value entered on the slider bar shall be scaled to this value.

attrib.name: Adjustment
attrib.para: The slider bar is automatically adjusted to the vertical center of the button if the slider bar text is on the side of the slider bar or adjusted to the horizontal center if the slider bar text is on above or below the slider bar; this attribute represents the positive or negative deviation in pixels of the slider bar from the center of the button.
This field is thus a signed value!

attrib.name: BorderColor
attrib.para: Color of the border of the slider bar.

attrib.name: Direction
attrib.para: Direction of the slider bar.

attrib.name: GapSize
attrib.para: The size in pixels between each slider bitmap.
This value is a signed value: the images can be overlapping, i.e. to create a smoother shading effect using alpha blended PNGs.

attrib.name: LineThickness
attrib.para: The thickness in pixels of line around the slider bar.

attrib.name: Margin
attrib.para: The distance in pixels from the edge of the button.

If the slider bar is on the right side of the button than this value represents the right edge. If it is on the left side than it represents the left. If it is on top than it represents the top margin. And if it is on the bottom then it represents the bottom margin.

attrib.name: Sound
attrib.para: Sound to play.

attrib.name: Duration
attrib.para: Duration of the sound action action, in milliseconds.

class.name: S_CFSOUND
class.para: This structure represents Wave file data

attrib.name: Size

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to the wave file data located somewhere else in the CF

class.name: S_CFSPECIALACTION
class.para: This structure encapsulates a GID that is specifying a special action like browse forward, go to home, page up etc. into an action.

attrib.name: SpecialAction
attrib.para: The special action this action encapsulates

class.name: S_CFSTATEMENT
class.para: This structure represents a statement as defined by the NHC protocol. It is subclassed to instantiate statements that can be interpreted by an extender.

class.name: S_CFSTATUSFIELD
class.para: A status field can be used to display the status of a list of objects in the system. See Subtype for details.

attrib.name: SubType
attrib.para: Subtype of the StatusField. See below.

entry.para: Displays time (i.e. 10:52pm)
Displays date (i.e. Mon Jan 01)
Displays current page number
Displays total number of pages of current device (Module)
Displays a bitmap when sending an IR-code
Displays a bitmap when battery is on low Voltage
Displays the battery level
Displays the WiFi network signal strength levelstatus
Possible values are:
0 = Wifi level 4
1 = Wifi level 3
2 = Wifi level 2
3 = Wifi level 1
4 = Wifi no connection
5 = Wifi fault connection
6 = Wifi level adhoc
7 = No network configured
8 = Ethernet ok
9 = Ethernet broken
10 = Ethernet unknown
Displays the USB connection status
Displays an on or off state
Displays an on or off state (specific for Lutron)
Displays the LCD TimeOut value
Displays the a page number and the number of pages
Displays the name of the current activity
Displays the backlight timeout (both LCD and buttons)
Displays the bitmap of the volume (no sound -> ... -> loud)
Displays the day of the date (i.e. 01)
Displays the month of the date (i.e. Jan)
Displays the year of the date (i.e. 2005)
Displays an edit box where text can be entered
Displays the current playing action
Displays the name of the page
Displays the free memory status
Displays the contrast of the LCD screen

attrib.name: Gid
attrib.para: GID of the StatusField

class.name: S_CFSTRING
class.para: The String structure contains string information for labels etc.

attrib.name: Size
attrib.para: The number of bytes in the data array. UTF-8 encoding uses variable byte length, so this value should not be interpreted as the number of characters!

note.para: ASCII is valid UTF-8, which means the first 128 characters defined in ASCII are also encoded as one byte characters in UTF-8.

attrib.name: cfData
attrib.para: Pointer to the array of character bytes, defining the actual string. It is a stream of UTF-8 bytes.

attrib.name: cfSystemPageActivities
attrib.para: The activity with system pages.
These pages have predefined values, see System Configuration section.

attrib.name: cfSystemAreaActivities
attrib.para: The activity with system areas.
These pages have predefined values, see System Configuration section.

attrib.name: cfHomeActivity
attrib.para: Home Activity

attrib.name: cfSystemActivity
attrib.para: System Activity

attrib.name: cfActivities
attrib.para: All activities in the configuration

attrib.name: cfExtenders
attrib.para: All extenders in the configuration

attrib.name: cfDevices
attrib.para: All devices in the configuration

attrib.name: cfSettings
attrib.para: Settings of the configuration

attrib.name: cfFonts
attrib.para: This is provided so that fonts can be loaded after CF download if required and not at display time.

attrib.name: cfScriptLibraries
attrib.para: Script libraries available in the user CF.
The files referenced in the array are expected to have a file type of 0x0101 (unencrypted JavaScript) or 0x0102 (encrypted JavaScript).

class.name: S_CFVISUALOBJECT
class.para: The S_CFVISUALOBJECT generalizes all objects that can be drawn on the GUI. It extends the S_CFLABELLEDOBJECT structure. All visual objects thus also have a label associated to them and group all common properties.

attrib.para: font used for the text on this visual object.

attrib.name: TextColor
attrib.para: text color of the visual object

attrib.name: TextBGColor
attrib.para: background color of the visual object

attrib.name: Position
attrib.para: position of this visual object

attrib.name: Dimension
attrib.para: dimension of this visual object

attrib.name: cfImages
attrib.para: Images associated with the visual object.

bit.name: Hidden
bit.para: Specifies if this object must be drawn or not

bits.name: HTextAlignment
bits.para: Horizontal alignment of the text on this visual object.

bits.name: VTextAlignment
bits.para: Vertical alignment of the text on this visual object.

bit.name: TextBold
bit.para: Specifies if text should be displayed in Bold.

bit.name: TextItalic

class.name: S_CFWIFI
class.para: This structure defines the properties for Wireless IP networking, on top of the regular IP networking properties defined in the configuration structures.

attrib.name: Object
attrib.para: Since this structure has been used as a contained structure it can’t be extended and no type has been assigned to it.

attrib.name: essid
attrib.para: Sequence of ASCII characters specifying the name of the wireless network.
A maximum of 33 bytes are supported (defined as ESSID_MAX_SIZE).

attrib.name: channel
attrib.para: Number from 0 to 15

attrib.name: dhcp
attrib.para: Indicates whether DHCP is enabled of not

attrib.name: mode
attrib.para: The operation mode of the wireless network.

attrib.name: encryption
attrib.para: Encryption format of the date traffic on the wireless network.

attrib.name: encryptionKeyType
attrib.para: Type of encryption on the wireless network. Indicates which field of this structure has to be used.

attrib.name: passkey
attrib.para: Sequence of ASCII characters specifying the pass key for the wireless network.
A maximum of 64 bytes are supported (defined as PASSKEY_MAX_SIZE).

attrib.name: passphrase
attrib.para: Sequence of ASCII characters specifying the pass phrase for the wireless network.
A maximum of 64 bytes are supported (defined as PASSPHRASE_MAX_SIZE).

attrib.name: ip_config
attrib.para: Contained S_CFIP_CONF structure

class.name: S_CFWIFITUNING
class.para: This structure defines the WiFi tuning properties to be used when a WiFi interface is available

It contains settings which ought to be part of the structure, but the structure is contained in the structure, and can not be changed anymore for backwards compatibility with older firmware. From now on any new refining of WiFi settings should be done by extending S_CFWIFITUNING.

attrib.name: interfaceIndex
attrib.para: Number from 0 to 255. Default is 0.

bit.name: Enabled
bit.para: indicates if the WiFi interface is enabled (1) or disabled (0).

attrib.name: scanTime
attrib.para: Number of milliseconds to wait for scan results on every channel.
A value of 100 is the default behaviour.

attrib.name: channelMask
attrib.para: Bitmask to restrict the number of channels to scan for access points. If a bit is set, the corresponding WiFi channel should be scanned.
For example, to only scan on WiFi channels 1, 6 and 11, the value 0x842 should be used.
To scan on all supported channels, specify value 0xFFFFFFFF (this is the value which it used if no pointer to an S_CFWIFITUNING structure is set in ).

note.para: The Maestro control panel firmware only supports IEEE 802.11b/g channels 1 through 14 in the 2.4GHz range. This implies that only bits 1-14 are taken into account. The other bits in this bitmask are reserved for possible future support of other frequency ranges, such as the 3.6GHz range of 802.11y, or the 5GHz range of 802.11a/h/j.

attrib.name: rescanInterval
attrib.para: Interval (in seconds) after which an access point should be initiated. If set to 0, an access point scan should only be performed when connectivity to an access point is lost.

attrib.name: bssid
attrib.para: Basic Service Set Identifier (BSSID) of the wireless network to connect to. If all-zeroes, the BSSID will be determined using probe requests (using the SSID).
In an infrastructure WiFi network, the BSSID is the MAC address of the wireless access point. In this case, specifying the BSSID only makes sense if a single access point is used.

In an ad-hoc (IBSS) network, the BSSID usually is a locally administered MAC address. However, the Maestro control panel firmware uses a BSSID of 02:22:01:02:03:XX, with XX being the WiFi channel number.

note.para: The bssid field is currently ignored by Maestro control panel firmware.

attrib.name: roamingMode
attrib.para: Specifies the roaming strategy to use.

attrib.name: region
attrib.para: Region to be used to determine the regulatory constraints for transmit power and allowed frequency.

note.para: The region field is currently ignored by Maestro control panel firmware.
